intro: Cardamine yungshunensis, commonly known as Yungshun watercress, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. It is notable for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
